column1: Sedentary habits in school-age children are linked to a risk for obesity and heart disease in adults.
In addition, children who are unable to express themselves well may be more likely to have aggressive behavior or temper tantrums.

Lying, cheating, and stealing are all examples of behaviors that school-age children may "try on" as they learn how to negotiate the expectations and rules placed on them by family, friends, school, and society.
Parents should deal with these behaviors in private with their child (so that the child's friends don't tease them).
- Children today are exposed, through the media and their peers, to many issues dealing with violence, sexuality, and substance abuse.
Being inactive at this age increases the risk of lifetime obesity.
